citeinfo.title: Land Use and Land Cover, Tompkins County NY, 2012

descript.abstract: The Tompkins County Planning Department produced a land use and land cover data set of Tompkins County, NY in 1995 and in 2009 updated the data using the 2007 natural color ortho-imagery. Further updates were made in 2012. The need for this data set has been identified by various county departments, local municipal agencies, and other not-for-profit organizations. High resolution natural color digital orthoimagery acquired from the NYS Office of Cyber Security and Critical Infrastructure Coordination (CSCIC), and a number of other secondary digital data sources (wetlands, hydrology, tax parcel and planimetric base data) were used to interpret and delineate land use and land cover directly on-screen. The land use and land cover classification system that was designed for the 1995 project to meet the needs of the users of these data was used for the 2007 data. In 1968, the Land Use and Natural Resource Inventory (LUNR) a state-wide land use and land cover mapping project, used aerial photographs to identify 130 land use and land cover classes. The Tompkins County land use and land cover classification system has been designed to be comparable with the LUNR classification system. Comparable classification systems will enable users to analyze changes in land use and land cover over the previous thirty year time period.
descript.purpose: Provides a county-wide data set of all land use and land cover classes in Tompkins County. Potential uses of these data include land use and land cover time change analysis, comprehensive planning and development suitability analysis.
descript.supplinf: This data set is derived from the interpretation and delineation of land use and land cover from high-resolution natural-color digital orthoimages.

idinfo.useconst: The following statement must be included with any products that use or are derived from this data set: "Data contained in this product was originally produced by the Tompkins County Planning Department and may not be reproduced or redistributed without the express written consent of the originator. The originator does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed by the data, as it is currently still in draft format."

citeinfo.title: Tompkins County Land Use and Land Cover 2007

citeinfo.origin: NYS Cyber Security and Critical Infrastructure Coordination
citeinfo.title: Tompkins County 24-inch and 6-inch Resolution Natural Color Ortho-imagery JP2

procstep.procdesc: 1. Conduct needs assessment 2. Devise Land Use and Land Cover Classification System and project specifications 3. Collect raw data - In this case obtain Digital Orthophotos from NYSDOP 4. Interpret data and delineate land use and land cover per specification 5. Digitally record data 6. Edit data 7. Conduct Accuracy Assessment 8. Final Report

enttyp.enttypd: Land use or land cover class, 2012
enttyp.enttypds: Classification system is based on LUNR, but has been adapted to meet the needs of the Tompkins County Planning Department

attr.attrdefs: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division

attrdomv.udom: Positive integers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Land Use and Land Cover classes devised by the staff in the Tompkins County Planning Department and the Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, based in part on the LUNR classification system from 1968.
attr.attrdefs: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999

edom.edomvd: Cropland: Tillable land used for growing cultivated field crops, forage crops, grain, beans, etc. Hedgerows separating defined Ac areas were delineated as separate classes (typically Fd, Fm, Fb or Fc) if they are greater than 20 meters wide
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Cattle: Farmland used for the feeding and milking of dairy cattle as well as for beef cattle. Barn with silos and feedlots are included.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Horse farm: Horse barns, feed lot, and animal recreation areas. (Pasture will be in Ap).
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Fishery/Aquaculture: Fishery ponds and associated buildings.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: High intensity cropland/horticulture: Nurseries, including green-houses, vegetable production areas, and other gardens more than a half-acre in size.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Inactive Agriculture: Farmland and fields that appear to be no longer used for farming practices. Fields may appear to be growing over with tall grasses and small shrubs.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Orchards: Farmland dedicated to growing tree products including associated buildings.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Pasture: Areas used for grazing. Is enclosed by fence and may have small trees and shrubs. Located adjacent to livestock farm
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Tree farm: Areas used for cultivating trees, primarily Xmas trees.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Vineyards: Grape growing farms and pastures which may include winery buildings.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Other farms: Poultry, sheep, swine, game, mixed animal farms, animal shelters, and farms that produce livestock feeds (granaries).
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Central Business District: Commercial/residential centers of city and villages where mixed land uses of Commercial, Public/Institutional, and high density Residential exist. There may be buildings that comprise more than one type of land use, such as a storefront on the first floor, offices on the second floor, and residences on the third floor. Land uses are mixed and are high in density.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Shopping Centers/Malls: Commercial areas that are predominately shopping centers and malls including significant surrounding parking facilities.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Offices: Buildings that contain administrative offices, as well as facilities that include business or technology services that are not predominantly retail orientated. Facilities may be part of a business/technology/industrial park. In some cases medical offices (Ph) may be included if they do not constitute the dominant land use.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Retail: Commercial areas along roadways not associated with distinct commercial centers or large shopping malls. Will include linear highway corridor development, as well as individual retail businesses and services that may exist within residential or industrial areas.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Commercial Storage: Indoor and outdoor commercial storage facilities for public rentals and warehouse/storage facilities not associated with adjacent commercial or industrial land uses.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Abandoned: Areas that include buildings and facilities that are interpreted as abandoned or vacant.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Barren Land: Land that is composed of either rock, gravel or sand, which cannot be cultivated or associated with any other defined land use class.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Disturbed Land: Land that has been cleared of vegetation and the interpretation of any identifiable or defined land use class is not possible.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Brush: Areas that have considerable growth of shrubs and small trees, but can not be classified as forest. The brush land cover must occupy at least 80% of the delineated area. Forest and grassland may be incorporated into the remaining 20%.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Coniferous Forest: Forested areas where needle trees, such as pine, spruce, fir and hemlock make up at least 80% of the tree cover.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Deciduous: Forested areas where broadleaf trees make up at least 80% of the tree cover.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Grassland: Open grassy areas with no associated adjacent land uses. May include small amounts of shrubs, trees and brush. The grassland cover must occupy at least 80% of the delineated area. The remaining 20% may be trees, shrubs and brush. Grassland areas may be naturally occurring, or may be regularly mowed.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Mixed forest: Forested areas with mixed coniferous and deciduous trees. The ratio of the predominant coniferous or deciduous tree stands must not exceed 80%.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Forest Plantation: Rows of mature trees, primarily conifers, planted by man
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Agriculture Industry: Buildings and facilities associated with agri-business
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Extractive: Salt mining operations, gravel pits, rock quarries.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Light Industry: Facilities and grounds that include activities associated with the manufacturing, processing, fabricating, assembly, finishing, packaging, warehousing, and outdoor storage of products.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Communication Towers: Communication tower sites at ground level including areas occupied by guide wires.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Utilities: Power plants and substations.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Campgrounds: Public and private camping areas, including areas designated for camping in state and town parks as well as private RV parks.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Recreation corridors: Areas characterized as linear recreation ways for uses such as trails and paths associated with outdoor recreation activities and pedestrian connections.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Golf Course: Includes driving ranges, club house and greens
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Hunt clubs: Land areas used specifically for the sport of hunting. May include shooting range and fields for practice of this sport.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Parks: Public parks as well as Cornell Plantations including picnic areas, walking/hiking/running trails, playgrounds, manicured lawns, and landscaped areas within park boundaries.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Youth & religious camps: Cabins and other buildings associated with summer camps and or religious retreats.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Recreational shoreline: Shoreline where land use is recreational lake access. Docks and boat moorings may exist. Consists of rocky shoreline land cover. Boundaries vary with lake levels.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Stadiums/track/ball fields: Sporting fields that may or may not be associated with schools and parks. Baseball diamonds, tennis courts, running track, soccer and football fields with goal posts, swimming facilities. Motor tracks included.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Cemetery: Cemeteries at least one-half acre in area.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Solid waste disposal: Waste disposal sites such as recycling centers, landfills, exposed dumps and private junk yards.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Educational: All schools, university and college academic buildings, research facilities, and associated parking facilities and quads. College campuses include other land uses that, if at least one-half acre in area, is designated as distinct LULC classes. Pe is used only for the academic and research related buildings and the surrounding parking lots and grounds. This class also includes other learning centers such as the Sciencenter, Cayuga Nature Center and the Fingerlakes School of Massage.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Community center, social hall, fraternal lodge: American Legions, Veterans associations, and community centers where social events, Bingo, pancake breakfasts and chicken bbq fund raisers occur.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Health facilities: Hospital, health clinics, medical offices, and nursing homes.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Correctional facilities: County jail, secure work camps, and other correctional centers.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Governmental office facilities: Includes all local, state, and federal governmental office facilities that are interpreted to be the dominant land use. This class includes courthouses, town halls, and other public service and administrative facilities.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Public works: Areas that include facilities for highway departments, fire departments, public safety, maintenance buildings, and related storage areas. Public works facilities present on the educational campuses that are at least one-half acre in area are classified as Pp.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Church/synagogue/monastery: Houses of worship. Delineated only if the parcel on which the facility(s) is located is at least one-half acre in area.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Sewage treatment facilities: Facilities whose primary function is the treatment of waste water.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Water Tank: Tank used as reserve of water, either for drinking water or for filling of fire department trucks.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Water management facilities: Facilities whose primary function is management of drinking water.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: High density residential: Residential land areas with approximately 5 or more dwellings on average per acre. Comprised mainly of urban areas of residential land use patterns including densities ranging from single family structures to multi-unit apartment buildings.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Low density residential: Residential land areas with a maximum average of 1 dwelling per acre.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Medium density residential: Residential land areas with more than 1, but less than 5 dwellings on average per acre.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Manufactured home park: Residential land areas with a density of 4 or more manufactured homes on average per acre and a designation of the property as a manufactured home park or subdivision.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Airport or active airstrip: Includes all public and private airport facilities, hangars, parking facilities, and runways.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Bus depot, fleet storage, garage for public vehicles: Places that store large number of cars, vans, trucks or buses for purposes of public use and transportation. Examples include Cornell?s fleet storage, T-CAT, ISCD school bus depot.
edom.edomvds: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999.

edom.edomvd: Highway: The limited access sections of Route 13 that include at least 4 total traffic lanes. Associated interchanges and ramps will also be delineated within this class.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Railroads: Active railroad right of ways including switchyards
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Marsh, bog, shrub wetlands: Areas of wetlands that contain grasses, scrub, brush, and are void of tall trees.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Reservoir: Bodies of water that are formed from damming creeks.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Natural Lake/Pond: Bodies of water that are not formed by damming creeks. Ponds may be man-made.
edom.edomvds: LUNR

edom.edomvd: Wooded Wetland: Wooded areas that show considerable amounts of water beneath the trees
edom.edomvds: LUNR

attr.attrdefs: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999

attr.attrdef: Any unusual or informative characteristics associated with the land use classification
attr.attrdefs: Tompkins County Planning Department and Tompkins County ITS GIS Division, 1999

attr.attrdef: generalized land use and land cover classes

Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area in square US survey feet

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: Cornell University provides these geographic data "as is". Cornell University makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. Cornell University further makes no warranty either expressed or implied, regarding the condition of the product or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these files have been processed successfully on computers at Cornell University, no warranty is made by Cornell University regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.

Tompkins County does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed in this data. The end user of the data and products derived from it agrees to accept the data "as is", with the full knowledge that errors and omissions may exist. The end user further agrees to hold harmless Tompkins County for any liability or damages that may result from an improper or inappropriate use of the data.

digtinfo.formspec: Arc/Info Coverage, Arc/Info GRID, Info Database, ArcView Shapefile, Dbase III Database, Access Database

stdorder.fees: The cost of reproduction for a standard data set, which varies depending on the type of media requested (zip disk, CD-ROM, floppy diskette, etc.). A standard data set is an Arc/Info coverage, Arc/Info export (.e00) file, ArcView shapefile, Dbase III database, or Microsoft Access database. Custom data sets or file types will incur additional labor costs.
stdorder.ordering: Submit a written request to the Tompkins County ITS GIS Division.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
